recipe.title: Eggs Benedict
recipe.description: Classic brunch dish with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce

steps.descr: Make hollandaise: whisk yolks and lemon juice over double boiler
steps.instructions: Make hollandaise: whisk yolks and lemon juice over double boiler

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started on our hollandaise sauce. Whisk those egg yolks with the lemon juice over a double boiler. You want it to be smooth and creamy.

steps.descr: Slowly drizzle in melted butter while whisking
steps.instructions: Slowly drizzle in melted butter while whisking

on_enter.say: Now, let's slowly drizzle in that melted butter while whisking. This is where the magic happens, so keep it steady and smooth.

steps.descr: Poach eggs in simmering water with vinegar for 3 minutes
steps.instructions: Poach eggs in simmering water with vinegar for 3 minutes

on_enter.say: Let's poach those eggs. Add a splash of vinegar to simmering water and gently slide in the eggs. We're aiming for three minutes here, for that perfect runny yolk.
While the eggs are poaching, let's toast those muffins until they're golden and crispy, and cook the bacon until it's nice and crispy too. The aroma will be irresistible!

steps.descr: Assemble: muffin, bacon, poached egg, hollandaise
steps.instructions: Assemble: muffin, bacon, poached egg, hollandaise

on_enter.say: Now for the fun part! Let's assemble our Eggs Benedict. Start with the muffin, then the crispy bacon, followed by the poached egg, and top it off with that luscious hollandaise sauce.
Let's finish it off with a sprinkle of fresh chives. It adds a lovely pop of color and a fresh taste.
Time to serve up your beautiful Eggs Benedict. Enjoy every bite, you've earned it!

notes.text:
Keep hollandaise warm but not hot
Fresh eggs poach best
Practice your poaching technique
